intro: Malapoenna nitens, commonly known as the Malapoenna nitens, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
